The Windows Personalization Utility (WPU) is a batch and registry script tool designed to give users control over Windows updates and system privacy. It allows for pausing updates indefinitely, removing telemetry, debloating apps and services, and applying various system tweaks for a more personalized Windows experience.

This Rust crate, `public-ip-address`, provides a straightforward way to retrieve a user's public IP address and associated geolocation data. It supports multiple lookup services, offers both asynchronous and blocking interfaces, and includes optional caching with encryption for privacy and performance.

ğŸ“ ğ—”ğ—•ğ—¢ğ—¨ğ—§ ğ—§ğ—›ğ—œğ—¦ ğ—£ğ—¥ğ—¢ğ—ğ—˜ğ—–ğ—§

WarpNet is a decentralized, peer-to-peer social network built with Go, inspired by Twitter. It operates without central servers, utilizing the Noise protocol for secure communication and local storage for data persistence. This design makes WarpNet censorship-resistant, scalable, and fully open-source.
